articles.title: Senior Officials of China Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Senior Officials of China Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Li Yuanchao, member of the Political Bureau, member of the Secretariat and head of the Organization Department of the C.C., Communist Party of China, paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Beijing on Friday to express deep condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Accompanying him were Shen Yueyue, permanent deputy head of the Organization Department of the C.C., CPC, Liu Jieyi, deputy head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., CPC, Song Tao, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of China, Deng Shengming, secretary-general of the Organization Department of the C.C., CPC, and other officials of the Organization Department and the International Liaison Department of the CPC Central Committee and the Foreign Ministry of China.
					
					 Laid before the portrait of Kim Jong Il were wreaths in the name of the Organization Department of the C.C., CPC and its head.
					
					 They bowed three times before the portrait to express their deep condolences.
					
					 Li Yuanchao said that Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people and a great friend of the Chinese people, would always be alive in the hearts of the two peoples.
					
					 He expressed belief that the Korean people would achieve greater successes in their efforts to build a thriving country, closely rallied around the Workers' Party of Korea under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the WPK Central Military Commission, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il.  
					
					 Earlier on Dec. 20 and 21, officials and personages of China and families of Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy in Beijing and its consulate general in Shenyang.
					
					 They included Cheng Guoping, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of China, Liu Zhenmin, assistant to the foreign minister, Wu Dawei, special envoy of China for the Korean Peninsula Affairs, Wang Min, secretary of the Liaoning Provincial Committee of the CPC, Dai Yulin, secretary of the Dandong City Committee of the CPC, Wang Yonggui, director of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Liaoning Provincial Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, Lieut. Gen. Zhang Xibo, commander of the Chinese People's Liberation Army in Hong Kong, Zeng Yinquan, chief executive of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, He Zhiping, chief secretary of China Hong Kong Zhonghwa Energy Fund Commission, personages of the Foreign Ministry of China, the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries, the All-China Women's Federation, the People's Bank of China, the Association for Promotion of Development of Chinese Culture and Liaoning Province, and famil
					
					 ies of anti-Chinese revolutionary fighter Li Zade, anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr Zhang Weihua, and Feng Zhongyun and Zhou Baozhong, persons related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle. 
					
					 Meanwhile, Chinese ambassadors to India, Laos, Nepal, Peru, Libya, Democratic Congo, Egypt, South Africa and France and their embassy officials paid condolatory visits to the DPRK missions in those countries. 
					
					 Diplomatic envoys of 50 odd countries including Russia, Mongolia, Vietnam, Iran, Bangladesh, Venezuela, Equatorial Guinea, Kuwait, Libya, Guinea and Rwanda to Beijing visited the DPRK missions to express condolences.

articles.title: CPRK Slams S. Korea of Barring Mourner Groups from Visiting DPRK
articles.content:
CPRK Slams S. Korea of Barring Mourner Groups from Visiting DPRK

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA Sunday slamming the south Korean authorities for barring south Koreans from all walks of life hoping to pay condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il from visiting the DPRK:
					
					 The Korean nation and the world are mourning in great sorrow the loss of a peerlessly great man.
					
					 Personages of not only those countries which have friendly relations with the DPRK but many other countries, to say nothing of Koreans are expressing deep condolences in bitter grief.
					
					 Broad south Koreans including those who had been involved in Pyongyang summits and political parties and organizations published condolence addresses, voicing their willingness to dispatch mourners groups.
					
					 Taking the ardent wish of south Koreans into full consideration, the DPRK decided to accept condolatory groups and missions of the south side and opened routes by land via Kaesong and air. It also took measures to provide every convenience to the visitors and guarantee their safety.
					
					 The south Korean authorities, however, have not only prevented south Koreans from visiting the DPRK to share grief with us but tried to justify their unethical acts talking about "violation of principle" and "occurrence of conflict among south Koreans" in a bid to quench the hot wind for condolatory visits to the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean chief executive even let loose sophism of "separating north leadership from the inhabitants", indicative of his design to escalate confrontation with the DPRK, in a bid to break the single-minded unity of the people in the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean puppet authorities' unethical acts bereft of elementary etiquette and compatriotism have touched off unanimous outrage and wrath among Koreans and all other people of the world.
					
					 The Koreans still shudder at the treacherous act committed by traitor Kim Young Sam 17 years ago as he hurt the nation which was languishing in bitter grief at the loss of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The DPRK will never tolerate anyone checking mourners, branding them as top class criminals seriously insulting the supreme dignity of the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should bear in mind that their obstructions will entail unpredictable catastrophic consequences to the north-south relations.
					
					 The nation will finally test the morality of the south Korean authorities as well as the sincerity of their call for improvement of the north-south relations.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Iranian President
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Iranian President

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a condolence message from Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad Saturday.
					
					 The president in his message said he could not repress grief at the news that HE Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the DPRK, passed away.
					
					 Expressing condolences to Kim Jong Un and to the government and people of the DPRK, the message wished him good health and success in his work and the government and people of the DPRK prosperity and glory.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Omani Sultan
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Omani Sultan

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, Monday received a message of condolences from Omani Sultan Qaboos Bin Said.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 I heard the sad news that leader Kim Jong Il passed away to my regret.
					
					 Please accept, Excellency, my sincere condolences and ask you to pass heartfelt sorrow on the people of the DPRK.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Bulgarian, Czech Party Leaders
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Bulgarian, Czech Party Leaders

					 Pyongyang December 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received messages of condolences from Alexander Paunov, first secretary of the C.C., Bulgarian Communist Party, Atanas Ivanov, honorary chairman of the Bulgarian Communists Union, and Miroslav Stepan, general secretary of the C.C., Czechoslovak Communist Party, on Dec. 20 and 21.
					
					 Alexander Paunov in his message said that the Korean people have lost the staunch fighter who put his heart and soul into the defence of independence of the DPRK against imperialism.
					
					 Atanas Ivanov praised leader Kim Jong Il as a prominent leader internationally recognized by the governments in all countries and the progressive forces.
					
					 Miroslav Stepan hoped that Kim Jong Un would accomplish the cause of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Rwandan Party Leader
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Rwandan Party Leader

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Tuesday received a message of condolences from Francois Ngarambe, general secretary of the Rwandan Patriotic Front, on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 In the message, he, on behalf of the National Executive Committee of the Front and on his own, expressed heartfelt sympathy and deep condolences to all members of the WPK.
					
					 The demise of Kim Jong Il is a great loss not only to the Korean people but to the world people, he stressed.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Indian Personage
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Indian Personage

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Dec. 21 received a message of condolences from Debabrata Biswas, general secretary of the All-India Forward Bloc. 
					
					 In the message Debabrata Biswas said he was greatly shocked at the sad news that Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, passed away all of a sudden. 
					
					 The All-India Forward Bloc has maintained close relations with the WPK founded by President Kim Il Sung and strengthened by Kim Jong Il, he added. 
					
					 He expressed belief that Kim Jong Il's life devoted to the happiness of the people, the Korean revolution and global independence would be remembered in the hearts of not only all the Korean people but also the world progressives.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Chilean Political Figures
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Chilean Political Figures

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of condolences from President Guillermo Teillier Del Valle and International Secretary Carlos Insunsa Rojas of the C.C., the Communist Party of Chile on Dec. 21. 
					
					 In the message they said that the Communist Party of Chile expressed deep condolences to Kim Jong Un and the WPK and all the people of the DPRK over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The message expressed belief that Kim Jong Un will continue dynamically advancing the drive to build a thriving socialist nation, accomplish the cause of national reunification and achieve the welfare of the Korean people, foiling the moves of the U.S. imperialists.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from Cambodian Party Leader
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from Cambodian Party Leader

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of condolences from Ouk Phurik, president of the Khmer Democratic Party of Cambodia, on Dec. 22.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 Upon hearing the news that HE Marshal Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, passed away on a train on Dec. 17, 2011, all the members of the Khmer Democratic Party of Cambodia and I can hardly repress sorrow.
					
					 HE Marshal Kim Jong Il laid down the Songun line of the DPRK based on the philosophical principle that the army precisely means the people, the party and the state and led the DPRK for decades to successfully carry forward and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by HE Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, great leader of the Korean people. His demise amounts to the Korean people's loss of an outstanding hero. 
					
					 Expressing profound condolences to the Korean people, we are convinced that the feats of HE Marshal Kim Jong Il will last forever.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from SG of SWAPO Party
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from SG of SWAPO Party

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of condolences from Pendukeni Iivula Ithana, secretary general of the South West Africa People's Organizational Party, on Dec. 22.
					
					 The message said that President of SWAPO Party and President of Namibia Hifikepunye Pohamba, Founding President Sam Nujoma, the vice-president, the secretary general, the leadership and the entire rank and file membership of SWAPO Party express their deepest sorrow over the passing of Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the WPK and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					
					 SWAPO Party would like to assure you Comrade Vice Chairman and the Leadership of the WPK as well as the people of the DPRK, of our support at any given material time, it said, adding:
					
					 SWAPO Party shall strive to maintain the excellent and cordial relationship between our two sister parties.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from WHO Director-General
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from WHO Director-General

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of condolences from Margaret Chan, director-general of the World Health Organization, on Dec. 22.
					
					 The director-general in the message expressed condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il on behalf of the WHO.
					
					 The WHO reiterates its support to the efforts of the people of the DPRK for the improvement of the residents' health conditions, it said.
					
					It expressed condolences to the people of the DPRK.

articles.title: Guinean People's Assembly Delegation Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Guinean People's Assembly Delegation Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Guinean People's Assembly made up of General Secretary Cisse Saloun and members of its leadership paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Conakry on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il on December 22.
					
					 The general secretary said:
					
					 The demise of HE Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, is a very painful loss not only to the Korean people but to the Guinean people and whole humankind. 
					
					 HE General Secretary Kim Jong Il was a staunch guardian and advocator of global independence and the greatest leader.
					
					We hope the WPK and the Korean people will overcome sorrow and certainly accomplish the cause of building a thriving nation desired by H.E. Kim Jong Il, true to the leadership of Comrade General Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 He made an entry in the mourners' book.

articles.title: Cambodian Parliamentary Delegations Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Cambodian Parliamentary Delegations Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Delegations of the Cambodian National Assembly and the People's Party of Cambodia Thursday paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy in Phnom-Penh on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 President Heng Samlin and members of the Cambodian National Assembly and Ney Pena, Presidium member of the Central Committee of the People's Party of Cambodia, and its leadership members laid wreaths before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and paid silent tribute.
					
					 The president wrote in the mourners' book that all of them express deepest condolences to the leadership of the fraternal DPRK and the Korean people. 
					
					The exploits performed by HE Marshal Kim Jong Il would last forever, he added.
					
					 Ney Pena made the following entry in the mourners' book: 
					
					 HE Marshal Kim Jong Il is the supreme leader who led the defence of the country and its construction to victory. The Korean people are highly praising his exploits and always remember his benevolence. The People's Party of Cambodia and the Cambodian people express the deepest condolences to the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people.
					
					 On the same day the chairman of the Cambodia－Korea Friendship Association and general secretary of the Cambodian National Olympic Committee also visited the DPRK embassy to mourn the demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Nepali PM Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Nepali PM Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Nepali Prime Minister Baburam Bhattarai Friday paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Katmandu on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 He expressed condolences before the portrait of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He said that he expresses his deepest condolences to the Workers' Party of Korea, the DPRK government and the Korean people over the demise of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 We wish the Korean party, government and people great successes in their future work under the leadership of Comrade Kim Jong Un, he added.

articles.title: Ethiopian Deputy PM Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Ethiopian Deputy PM Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Authorized by the Ethiopian president, Haile-Mariam Dessalegn, Ethiopian deputy prime minister and concurrently foreign minister, Thursday paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Addis Ababa on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. He was accompanied by officials concerned including the director-general for Asia of the foreign ministry.
					
					 They expressed deep condolences before the portrait of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He noted that the president wished to visit the DPRK embassy himself to express condolences but he could not do so due to severe spasm of chest pain, shocked by the sad news which came like a bolt from the blue.
					
					 He continued: The president authorized me to go to the DPRK embassy quickly to express condolences on his behalf.
					
					 I believe the DPRK will overcome the present sorrow and continue to advance under the leadership of HE Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Equatorial Guinean PM Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Equatorial Guinean PM Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Ignacio Milan Tang, prime minister of Equatorial Guinea, paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Malabo on Dec. 23 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He was accompanied by officials of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, International Cooperation and Francophone Affairs and the prime minister's office.
					
					 The prime minister and his party expressed condolences before the portrait of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He wrote in the mourners' book:
					
					 On behalf of HE Obiang Nguema Mbasogo, president of the Republic of Equatorial Guinea, founder-chairman of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea and president of the African Union, and the government of Equatorial Guinea, I express our deepest condolences over the demise of Comrade Kim Jong Il, leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, and deep sympathy to the fraternal Korean people and the bereaved family in sorrow.
					
					 The demise of HE Kim Jong Il is a great loss not only to the Korean people but also to the Equatorial Guinean people, who lost their close friend.
					
					 Though he passed away, his immortal feats will remain long in the hearts of the Korean people.
					
					 The government of Equatorial Guinea will continue to strengthen the friendly and cooperative relationship with the DPRK, an old friend, as it did when HE Kim Jong Il was alive.

articles.title: FM of Democratic Congo Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
FM of Democratic Congo Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Alexis Thambwe Mwamba, representative of the government of Democratic Congo, Thursday paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Kinshasa on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He was accompanied by officials of the Foreign Ministry of Democratic Congo including a department director, and diplomatic, political and information advisers to him.
					
					 They laid a wreath before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and paid profound condolences.
					
					 The Foreign Minister said the government and people of Democratic Congo are stricken with the bitterest grief and sorrow upon hearing the sad news of the demise of HE Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The demise of HE Kim Jong Il is a great loss to the DPRK, he added.
					
					 He expressed the deepest condolences to the government and people of the DPRK and the bereaved family on behalf of the government and people of Democratic Congo. 
					
					 He expressed hope that the Korean people would overcome sorrow and register steady successes.

articles.title: Myanmar FM Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Myanmar FM Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Myanmar Foreign Minister Wunna Maung Lwin, together with the director general, deputy director general and others of the Foreign Ministry, on Saturday paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in their country on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The foreign minister and his party laid a wreath before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and observed a moment's silence.
					
					 He said that the leadership and government of Myanmar are expressing heartfelt condolences on the sudden demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 President Thein Sein and the leadership of Myanmar, hardly repressing bitter grief at his demise, hope that the Korean people will overcome sorrow and display strength to realize his intention without fail under the distinguished guidance of HE the great supreme leader Kim Jong Un, the foreign minister said.
					
					 He expressed the conviction that Kim Jong Un will lead the DPRK to victory.

articles.title: Pakistani FM Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Pakistani FM Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Pakistani Foreign Minister Hina Rabbani Khar paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Islamabad on Dec. 23 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 She expressed profound condolences over Kim Jong Il's demise on behalf of the Pakistani government and people.
					
					 She said:
					
					 HE Kim Jong Il was respected by the Korean people and the world people as a great leader.
					
					 I firmly believe that the resourceful Korean people will make a dynamic advance, following leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 I sincerely wish Kim Jong Un success in all affairs.

articles.title: Acting Chairperson of AU Commission Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Acting Chairperson of AU Commission Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The acting chairperson of the African Union Commission Thursday paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Addis Ababa on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He paid a silent tribute before the portrait of Kim Jong Il, expressing deep condolences. He made an entry in the mourners' book.
					
					 He noted he paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy upon the authorization of Chairperson Jean Ping who was visiting foreign countries.
					
					 He said: We all the member states and people of the African Union are sharing today's sorrow with the Korean people.
					
					 HE Kim Jong Il was the great leader whom not only the Korean people but all African people respected and revered. 
					
					 His exploits performed for the independent development of the African countries will always be remembered.

articles.title: Lao Personages Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Lao Personages Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Personages of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, Kaysone Phomvihane Memorial and the State Veterans Committee of Laos paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy in Vientiane on Dec. 21.
					
					 They laid wreaths before a portrait of leader Kim Jong Il and observed a moment's silence.
					
					 They wrote in a condolence book that the life of Kim Jong Il was that of a great revolutionary who devoted his all to the socialist cause.

articles.title: Laotians Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Laotians Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Delegations of the National Assembly, Ministry of Defence, Organization Committee of the C.C., People's Revolutionary Party and National Organization for the Studies of Politics and Administration of Laos on Friday paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy in Vientiane over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They laid wreaths before his portrait and paid a silent tribute to him.
					
					 The president of the National Assembly who is member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP) wrote in the mourner's book that the demise of Kim Jong Il is a great loss not only to the Korean people but to the world revolutionary people advocating the global peace, independence and prosperity.
					
					 The director of the General Political Department of the Laotian People's Army who is secretary of the C.C., LPRP and vice-minister of Defence wrote in the mourner's book:
					
					 I, on behalf of all the servicepersons of the Lao Ministry of Defence, express deep condolences over the demise of Comrade Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Meanwhile, Cuban and Cambodian ambassadors to this country laid wreaths before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and expressed deep condolences over his demise on Thursday.

articles.title: Guinean Party Leader Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Guinean Party Leader Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Guinean People's Assembly consisting of its General Secretary Cisse Saloun and its leadership members paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Conakry on Dec. 22 over the demise of leader           Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The general secretary said:
					
					 The demise of HE General Secretary Kim Jong Il is a very painful loss not only to the Korean people but to the Guinean people and the peoples of the rest of the world.
					
					 HE General Secretary Kim Jong Il was a staunch defender and advocator of global independence and the greatest leader.
					
					 We hope that the Workers' Party and  people of Korea will overcome the grief and surely achieve the cause of building a thriving nation as desired by HE Kim Jong Il true to the leadership of General Comrade Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 He made an entry in the mourners' book.

articles.title: Senior Italian Lawmaker Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Senior Italian Lawmaker Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Lamberto Dini, president of the Commission for Foreign Affairs of the Senate of Italy who is former Foreign Minister, paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Rome on Dec. 22 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 He expressed condolences on his demise before the portrait. 
					
					 He said that Kim Jong Il passed away all of a sudden at a very important juncture when the international prestige of the DPRK was rising and economic construction was making successful progress thanks to his energetic guidance, adding this was a great loss and pain to the Korean people. 
					
					 He hoped that the Korean people would overcome the present sorrow and turn the DPRK into an economic power under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 He made an entry in the mourners' book.

articles.title: Cambodian Party Delegation Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Cambodian Party Delegation Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Khmer Democratic Party of Cambodia led by its President Ouk Phurik on Thursday visited the DPRK embassy in Phnom Penh to express condolences on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The delegation laid a wreath before the portrait of Kim Jong Il before observing a moment's silence.
					
					 The head of the delegation wrote in the mourners' book:
					
					 President Ouk Phurik of the Khmer Democratic Party and his wife and all the members of its Leadership express their deepest condolences to the Korean people over the demise of HE Marshal Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 His exploits will shine long.

articles.title: Peruvians Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Peruvians Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Political parties and organizations and personages of different circles in Peru visited the DPRK embassy in Lima in the period from Dec. 20 to 22 to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 They included the Communist Party (Red Motherland), People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students, New Left Movement, Revolutionary Socialist Party, Socialist Party, Communist Party, American Popular Revolutionary Alliance, the general bureau of Protocol, general bureau for affairs of overseas Peruvian citizens and consul-general, general bureau for Asian and Oceania affairs of the Foreign Ministry, Center of the Workers, People's Women Union, Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the 100th Birth Anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, Group for the Study of Kimilsungism,  General Kim Jong Il Peruvian Amicable Institution, Association for the Study of Revolutionary Activities of Comrade Kim Jong Suk, Kim Jong Suk Library, Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea and the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship and a district governor of Lima City, manager of the ABJ Ingenieros & CA S.A,C.
					
					 They laid wreaths before the portrait of Kim Jong Il at the embassy and expressed deep condolences over his demise.
					
					 Meanwhile, diplomatic envoys of Russia, Cuba, Egypt, Ecuador and Dominica to this country paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy.

articles.title: Russian Personages Visit DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Russian Personages Visit DPRK Missions

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Russian personages from different circles paid condolatory visits to the DPRK missions in their country between Dec. 20 and 22 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Among them were those of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ministry of Defense, Ministry of Transport, Ministry of Extraordinary Situation, Presidential Envoy Office of the Far East Region, Office of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Khabarovsk, Khabarovsk Territorial Government, administrations of Nakhodka, Artyom, Partizansk and Vladivostok cities, "United Russia" Party, Communist Party of the Russian Federation, "A Just Russia", Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, Russian Public Circles Committee for Liaison with the DPRK, Far Eastern Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Songun Policy, Maritime Territorial Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Songun Policy, Russia-Korea Friendship Association of Khabarovsk Territory, Friendship Association with Foreign Countries of Khabarovsk Territory, State Academy Beryozka Dancing Troupe Named after N.S. Nadezhdina, State Academic Igor Moiseyev Dance Company, State Ac
					
					 ademic People's Chorus Named after M.E. Pyatnichki, Moscow Tchaikovsky State Conservatory, Far-Eastern State University for Communications, Orthodox Church, Gazprom, the ITAR-TASS, the Voice of Russia and the newspaper Patriot.
					
					 They laid wreaths, floral baskets and bouquets before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and paid a silent tribute to him.
					
					 They made entries in the condolence book.

articles.title: Nigerians Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Nigerians Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Ibrahim Mantu, member of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria and former deputy president of the Senate of Nigeria, and M. M. Alhassan, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, and his party paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy on Dec. 20 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They laid flowers before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and observed a moment's silence.
					
					 Ibrahim Mantu said:
					
					 The demise of HE Kim Jong Il is a great loss not only to the Korean people but also to the whole mankind.
					
					 I am sure that though he passed away, the Korean people will overcome their sorrow with indomitable will and steadily advance the Korean revolution under the leadership of General Kim Jong Un.
					
					 M. M. Alhassan said: Charmed by the personality of Kim Jong Il as a great man, I am traveling the road of study and dissemination of the Juche idea of my own accord, not at other's request. I keenly experience how great loss his demise is. 
					
					 Meanwhile, diplomatic envoys of Ghana and Burundi to Nigeria paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy on Dec. 19 and 20.

articles.title: Mexican Personages Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Mexican Personages Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Personages of political and social circles in Mexico paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy in Mexico City on Dec. 21 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included Cuautemoc Amezcua Dromundo, chairman of the C.C., Socialist Popular Party, and members of its Leadership, Chairman Benigno Gonzales Villasana and members of the Mexico-Korea Friendship Association and a daughter of Carnero Checa, former secretary general of the Federation of Latin American Journalists. 
					
					 The visitors laid flowers before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and expressed deep condolences.
					
					 Cuautemoc Amezcua Dromundo wrote in the mourners' book:
					
					 The demise of the great Comrade Kim Jong Il is the greatest national loss to the Korean people and a great shock to the world revolutionary parties and socialist movement.
					
					 The DPRK will remain undeterred under the wise leadership of Comrade Kim Jong Un, the great successor to the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 On the same day the charges d'affaires a.i. of the Vietnamese and Indonesian embassies in Mexico paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy.

articles.title: Korean Residents in Russia Visit DPRK Consulate General
articles.content:
Korean Residents in Russia Visit DPRK Consulate General

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Russia-resident Koreans visited the DPRK consulate general in Nakhodka on Dec. 23 to express condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Among them were officials of the United Confederation of Koreans in Maritime Territory of Russia, the deputy chief of the Korean Cultural Centre in Vladivostok, the vice-chairman of the Renewal Association in Ussuriysk, the chairman and members of the Elders Association in Ussuriysk and the vice-chairman of the Elders Association in Artyom.
					
					 The compatriots laid wreaths and bunches of flowers before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and observed a moment's silence in humblest reverence.
					
					 They conveyed their condolatory letters addressed to Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, to the consul general.
					
					 Pak Phyong Won, chairman of the United Confederation, wrote in the condolence book:
					
					 Comrade Kim Jong Il is the prominent leader who devoted all his life to the prosperity of the country, the people's happiness and national reunification and to the development of the friendly relations between the DPRK and Russia and global peace and stability.
					
					 His exploits will be glorified to the last by Comrade Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The presence of respected Comrade Kim Jong Un will inspire us with confidence.

articles.title: Wreaths from Cambodian Great King and King
articles.content:
Wreaths from Cambodian Great King and King

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Cambodian Great King Norodom Sihanouk and King Norodom Sihamoni sent wreaths to the bier of leader Kim Jong Il on his demise.
					
					 They were laid before the bier of Kim Jong Il placed in the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Sunday by Chhorn Hay, Cambodian ambassador to the DPRK, and embassy staff members.

articles.title: Wreath from Guinean President
articles.content:
Wreath from Guinean President

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Guinean President Alpha Conde sent a wreath on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The wreath was laid before his bier lying at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Sunday.

articles.title: Wreath from Czech Political Party
articles.content:
Wreath from Czech Political Party

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party presented a wreath on the demise of Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 The wreath was laid before the bier of Kim Jong Il in the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Sunday.
					
					A wreath sent from the Hungarian Communist Workers' Party was also laid before his bier on the same day.

articles.title: Wreaths from Political Parties of Bangladesh
articles.content:
Wreaths from Political Parties of Bangladesh

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were sent to the bier of leader Kim Jong Il by political parties, organizations and personages of Bangladesh and Italy. 
					
					 They were from the C.C., the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, the C.C., the Socialist Party of Bangladesh, the Bangladesh People's League, the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea, the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship Solidarity Committee.
					
					  They were also from Dilip Barua, minister of Industry of Bangladesh and general secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party of Bangladesh (Marxist-Leninist); Hasanul Huq Inu, chairman of the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh National Socialist Party; Ghazi Zafar Ahmed, former prime minister of Bangladesh; the editor of the Bangladeshi paper Blits; the general director of the Bangladeshi Cosmos Company; the manager of a granite mining company of Bangladesh; Giancarlo Elia Valori, chairman of the Italian General Investment Group; Baeli, president of "C.I.S. Estero" Group of Italy.
					
					 The wreaths were laid before the bier of Kim Jong Il placed in the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Sunday.

articles.title: Wreaths from Foreign Organizations
articles.content:
Wreaths from Foreign Organizations

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna and the Switzerland-Korea Committee sent wreaths on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They were placed before the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il at Kim Il Sung Square on Sunday.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Staff members of Cambodian, Iranian, Pakistani, Egyptian and Brazilian embassies here Sunday expressed condolences to the bier of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Laid before the bier were wreaths in the name of the Cambodian and Iranian embassies.
					
					 The mourners paid a silent tribute in humble reverence to the bier of Kim Jong Il and went round it.
					
					 They made entries in the mourner's book.

articles.title: Mourners' Group of Chongryon Visits Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Mourners' Group of Chongryon Visits Bier of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of mourners of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) led by Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of its Central Standing Committee, on Dec. 25 called at Kim Il Sung Square to express condolences before the portrait of leader Kim Jong Il with bright smile on his face displayed there.
					
					 They laid bunches of flowers before the portrait and paid a silent tribute with boundless reverence for him who conducted energetic activities for prosperity of the country and the people's happiness and the strengthening of Chongryon and performed undying feats on behalf of the era and history.

articles.title: Chinese People Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Chinese People Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Families of Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle Sunday expressed condolences before the bier of leader Kim Jong Il. They included the family of Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Baozhong, the family of Feng Zhongyun and Chai Long, a great-grandson of Chai Shiying.
					
					 Standing beside the bier was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Placed there amid the playing of a dirge was a wreath in the name of the family of Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Baozhong.
					
					 The mourners paid silent tribute to his bier in humble reverence.
					
					 Zhou Wei wrote in the mourners' book that she believed the party, army and people of the DPRK firmly united around Comrade General Kim Jong Un would carry forward and accomplish the revolutionary cause of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, adding Kim Jong Il would live forever in their hearts.
					
					 Foreign guests staying in the DPRK also visited the bier of Kim Jong Il and mourned his demise on the same day. They included

articles.title: Chinese People Visit Kumsusan Memorial Palace
articles.content:
Chinese People Visit Kumsusan Memorial Palace

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Baozhong who was related to the anti－Japanese revolutionary struggle in China, visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace where the bier of leader Kim Jong Il is placed to mourn his demise. 
					
					 She said in bitter grief:
					
					 We were seized with indescribable sorrow upon hearing the sad news of demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 All of us, looking up to the sky of Pyongyang, bitterly cried "General, our father, you should not leave us behind. Rise up, please."
					
					 We have wished him good health as he has been shouldering upon himself the heavy responsibility of the revolution.
					
					 Now we cannot meet the great general any more. How lamentable it is.
					
					 He took utmost care of children of the comrades who fell in action while fighting alongside President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 We keenly felt he was our real father.
					
					 His sense of moral obligation went beyond the border of the country.
					
					 The history of his noble revolutionary obligation will shine forever.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, our kind-hearted father, is always with us.

articles.title: UCKR Decides to Organize All-Koreans Mourning Committee
articles.content:
UCKR Decides to Organize All-Koreans Mourning Committee

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Russia Tuesday held an urgent meeting in connection with mourning events on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 At the meeting the organization decided to organize the All-Koreans Mourning Committee for expressing deep reverence for Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The organization also decided to set a mourning period ending Dec. 28, pay a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Moscow, dispatch a mourners delegation to the homeland, let Koreans of all social standings make public messages and statements of condolences, hold mourning meetings of compatriots and so on, it said.

articles.title: Chinese Related to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle Here
articles.content:
Chinese Related to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle Here

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Families of Zhang Weihua, a Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, and Kim Sun Ok, a China-resident Korean related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, arrived here Sunday to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: KPA Servicepersons Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
KPA Servicepersons Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Servicepersons of the Korean People's Army Sunday visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace where the bier of leader Kim Jong Il is placed and expressed condolences on his demise.
					
					 The palace where the national flag was hoisted at half-mast was in bitter sorrow over the great loss to the nation.
					
					 The bier of Kim Jong Il is bedecked with flowers and his body draped in a red flag.
					
					 Standing beside the bier was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Members of the National Funeral Committee were standing vigil by the side of the bier and guards of honor of the three services of the KPA and the Worker-Peasant Red Guards were standing on either side of the bier.
					
					 Amid the solemn playing of the dirge the wreaths in the name of KPA units were laid.
					
					 KPA servicepersons observed a moment's silence, looking up to the lofty image of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Before the bier of Kim Jong Il they vowed to remain loyal to the leadership of Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the revolutionary armed forces, representing the unanimous feelings of all the servicepersons of the KPA.

articles.title: Increasing Number of People Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Increasing Number of People Visit Bier of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- An endless stream of mourners in bitter sorrow is flowing to the Kumsusan Memorial Palace where the bier of leader Kim Jong Il lies. 
					
					 On Sunday the mourning venue was visited by officials of ministries and national institutions, officials and working people from Jagang, South Hamgyong, North Hamgyong and Ryanggang provinces and Rason City,. 
					
					 Placed there amid the playing of a dirge were wreaths in the name of the Korean Revolution Museum, the Sericulture and Silk Fabrics Guidance Bureau, the Ministry of Land and Environmental Conservation, the Tideland Construction Guidance Bureau, delegations of mourners from the said provinces and Rason City. 
					
					 The mourners could not help weeping bitterly before the bier of Kim Jong Il who lies in state. 
					
					 They renewed their pledge and faith to overcome the present bitter sorrow and rise up with redoubled strength and courage and uphold Kim Jong Un as supreme leader of the WPK and the army, unite closer around him and successfully realize the plan of Kim Jong Il for a thriving nation.

articles.title: People in North Phyongan and Hwanghae Provinces Mourn
articles.content:
People in North Phyongan and Hwanghae Provinces Mourn

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- An increasing number of people are turning out to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Officials and working people of various circles and school youth and children in North Phyongan Province are visiting the large portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il, mosaics depicting him and mourning stations to express condolences in bitterest grief.
					
					 Lamentation is heard from people of Rakwon, Suphung, Kusong City, Ryongchon, Thaechon, Changsong and Pyokdong counties and other areas of North Phyongan Province as they are overcome with bitter sorrow over the loss of their father who demised on a running train while working heart and soul to bring earlier a rich and powerful country without having a moment's rest.
					
					 Looking up to the large portrait of Kim Jong Il, officials of party and power organs and working people's organizations and working people in the province are renewing their pledge to successfully fulfill his behests, holding in high esteem respected Kim Jong Un, wise leader of the party, state and army.
					
					 Mourners in North Hwanghae Province evinced their resolution to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem forever and remain true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The workers of the Hwanghae Iron Complex, the Sariwon Essential Foodstuff Factory, the Sariwon Textile Mill, the Jongbangsan General Foodstuff Factory and the Sariwon Chicken Farm also rose above their bitter sorrow with courage.
					
					 They are bringing about signal innovations and leaping advances in their work, determined to take the lead in the on-going march for great surge, always remembering the image of tender-hearted Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Mourners Touched by Kim Jong Un's Special Measures
articles.content:
Mourners Touched by Kim Jong Un's Special Measures

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- With all the people lamenting over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il, Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, took special measures to set up more service facilities for mourners' health around the mourning sites.
					
					 He also gave instructions to officials to make an on-site survey of the situation and offer every possible convenience to the mourners.  
					
					Ri Ju O, who works at the Secretariat of the Cabinet, told KCNA:
					
					 "According to respected Comrade Kim Jong Un's instructions, many organs have set up hot drink and medical service facilities for mourners' health around the mourning sites.   Among them are the General Bureau of Public Service, Rakwon Guidance Bureau, Taehung Guidance Bureau, Pyongyang University of Medicine Teaching Hospital affiliated with Kim Il Sung University and Central District People's Hospital. 
					
					 Officials dispatched to the mourning sites are taking rapid steps to fully provide service conditions."
					
					 An Chol Ryong, a 45-year-old resident in Moranbong District, said:
					
					 "Taking hot drink, we felt the fatherly love for our people that has continued through generations."

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Loving Care for People
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Loving Care for People

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea,  has personified the love shown by leader Kim Jong Il for the people. 
					
					 On December 24, all the servicepersons and people were deeply touched by the warm love shown by Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He earnestly instructed the officials to provide the people with convenience on a top-priority basis under any circumstances so that they might not be affected while mourning the demise of Kim Jong Il day and night in profound grief. 
					
					 He underscored the need to take thorough healthcare measures for the people missing Kim Jong Il very much and falling into a swoon. And he told officials to console the mourners on the spot, offering them warm water.
					
					 Yesterday Kim Jong Un made sure that fresh fishes were supplied to every family in Pyongyang in reflection of Kim Jong Il's warm love for people and today he took a special step for meeting people's interests and providing the best conveniences to them on a top-priority basis under any circumstances.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, identical to Kim Jong Il, is the popular tender-hearted father and the sun of the destiny as he is the man the people will follow to the end of the earth. 
					
					Kim Jong Il is always with us.

articles.title: Warm Care Shown by Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Warm Care Shown by Kim Jong Un

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, made sure with his loving care on Sunday that a large quantity of sugar was sent to mobile service networks in the wake of taking a measure to provide convenience to the people visiting outdoor mourning stations in grief over the great loss to the nation on a top priority basis under any circumstances.
					
					 Under this care warm sweet water was served to those at the mourning stations in the capital in greater quantities.
					
					 The people from all walks of life and school youth and children who visited the stations at Kim Il Sung Square, plazas of the Party Founding Memorial Tower, the April 25 House of Culture and the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium and other places in the capital were deeply moved to receive warm sweet water.
					
					 He also made sure that hot packs were sent and soya-based drink, honeyed water, various kinds of tea and warm water were provided to people so that they might not feel cold. Not yet feeling assured, he repeatedly took such kind steps. He is such meticulous and tender-hearted man.
					
					 It is due obligation for the people to visit those stations, ardently missing the nation's father whom they trusted and followed as Heaven. They revere him as an incarnation of humanity.
					
					 The loving care repeatedly shown by Kim Jong Un for people when the whole nation is overcome with sorrow will be conveyed to posterity as a legend about love for people.

articles.title: Koreans Deeply Touched by Measures for Mourners' Health
articles.content:
Koreans Deeply Touched by Measures for Mourners' Health

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- A few days ago, Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, took measures to install more medical and service facilities in mourning sites, afraid of the health of people coming to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il in cold days.
					
					 Upon hearing the news, Pak Pyong Jong, first vice-chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, told KCNA:
					
					 "Earlier, a day ago, he took a measure to supply fresh fish to Pyongyang citizens, who are seized with grief at leader Kim Jong Il's demise. 
					
					 Such measures can be taken only by Comrade Kim Jong Un, who is carrying forward deep love for the people shown by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in their lifetime." 
					
					 Pak Hyong Ryol, manager of the Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory, said:
					
					 "I was deeply moved by Comrade Kim Jong Un's deep loving care for the people. Though he is suffering the bitterest grief at the demise of leader Kim Jong Il, he is deeply concerned for the people. He is, indeed, identical to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il. I will faithfully serve the people, true to Comrade Kim Jong Un's noble idea of putting the interests of people above anything else."

articles.title: Korean People Vow to Remain Faithful to Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Korean People Vow to Remain Faithful to Kim Jong Un

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Korean people have seen on TV Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, expressing deep condolences and standing guard of honor beside the bier of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, looking at servicepersons and people writhing in sorrow for the loss of their leader, gets his eyes bedewed with tears.
					
					 He, unable to keep back his tears, takes a handkerchief from his pocket. He is suffering grief much bitterer than others. 
					
					 But he, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il, took special measures to transport fresh fishes to Pyongyang to supply them to the citizens in time though it is the mourning period. 
					
					 Deeply moved by the measures, all of the Korean people feel that Kim Jong Un is the leader of the people, as great as Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Before the bier of Kim Jong Il the Korean people vow to always venerate him and remain faithful to the leadership of Kim Jong Un.  They also sincerely wish good health to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Korean People Vow to Uphold Kim Jong Un's Leadership
articles.content:
Korean People Vow to Uphold Kim Jong Un's Leadership

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- All the Korean servicepersons and people, seized with grief at the sudden demise of leader Kim Jong Il, vow to closely rally around Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, and remain faithful to his Songun (military-first) revolutionary leadership.
					
					 Han Son Dok, an officer of the Korean People's Army, told KCNA:
					
					 "We servicepersons will demonstrate the stamina of Songun Korea united in one mind around respected Comrade Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the revolutionary armed forces, changing our bitterest sorrow into strength and courage."
					
					 He said this year would be recorded in history as not only a year of national mourning but also a year of great unity when the Korean party, army and people started to advance resolutely towards a new victory under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, the great successor to the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 Kim Sa Myong, director of the Control Machine Institute under the State Academy of Sciences, said:
					
					  "Though the Korean people are suffering the bitterest grief, they never yield to difficulties in despair. We feel confident as we are led by respected Comrade Kim Jong Un. Experiencing the sorrow for the loss of our leader, we are convinced Comrade Kim Jong Un, identical to leader Kim Jong Il, is our destiny.
					
					 Through his seasoned politics and noble traits of leadership we also keenly feel that he is another great sun. General Kim Jong Un, the outstanding leader of our party, army and people, is the eternal banner of our victory."

articles.title: 30000 Service Stands and 10000 Medical Posts Set up
articles.content:
30000 Service Stands and 10000 Medical Posts Set up

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- One week has passed since Koreans lost leader Kim Jong Il, father of the nation.
					
					 Service stands and medical posts have been set up close to mourning sites across the country as mourners suffer from growing pain of loss.
					
					 According to information available, more than 30,000 service stands and at least 10,000 medical posts have been established across the country as of December 24 where services and medical treatment for mourners are provided.
					
					 At least 450 hot water stands and more than 100 flower stands as well as 360-odd makeshift buildings have been set up in Pyongyang. 
					
					 More than 1,660 medical workers and at least 210 ambulances are on standby.
					
					 Stands and posts are on the steady increase.
					
					 This was at the instructions of respected Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, caring for the people visiting the mourning sites in the cold weather.

articles.title: People Regrettable for Not Having Set up Kim Jong Il's Statue
articles.content:
People Regrettable for Not Having Set up Kim Jong Il's Statue

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The Korean people, stricken with grief at the demise of leader Kim Jong Il, are remorseful for not having erected his statue in his lifetime.
					
					 Their remorse has run higher as they read an article of Rodong Sinmun Sunday about the story that Kim Jong Il did not allow his statue to be erected.
					
					 In Juche 88 (1999), many people, including servicepersons, sent letters to the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, calling for erecting a statue of Kim Jong Il to mark his 60th birthday.
					
					 Sculptors of the Mansudae Art Studio also sent a design of his statue they intended to erect in Samjiyon area, Ryanggang Province, to the WPK Central Committee on several occasions.
					
					 But Kim Jong Il refused their requests, saying that he only thought of achieving national reunification and building a thriving nation by carrying forward the revolutionary cause of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He said he still had many important tasks, including economic development, improvement of the people's living and national reunification, to implement in order to carry out all of the pledges he had taken before the bier of the President, so that he could not accept their requests.
					
					 Ri Sun Gu, a teacher at Kim Hyong Jik University of Education, told KCNA:
					
					 "I am deeply moved by the article. He did not allow his statue to be erected but took measures to build statues of revolutionary fighters, heroes and patriotic martyrs who contributed to the liberation and prosperity of the country. He was, indeed, a peerless patriot."

articles.title: Koreans Greet Year-end in Grief
articles.content:
Koreans Greet Year-end in Grief

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The Korean people are greeting the closing days of the year in bitter grief at the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They stay long in mourning sites in midwinter days, weeping for the loss of their leader.
					
					 Kim Jong Il spent his last days in field guidance tours.
					
					 He gave on-site guidance to various domains of South Hamgyong Province to indicate ways for the nation's prosperity, highly appreciating the province's workers for their achievements.
					
					 When visiting the Hana Music Information Centre a few days before his demise, he promised sending to the centre all music pieces he collected for scores of years for the musical entertainment of the people.
					
					 He also visited the Kwangbok Area Supermarket, which was ready to open, and acquainted himself with prices and quality of commodities and their procurement.
					
					 His field guidance tours in December were part of the uninterrupted long journey he made all his life for the happiness of the people.

articles.title: Large Buses Appear in Mourning Site to Warm Mourners
articles.content:
Large Buses Appear in Mourning Site to Warm Mourners

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Large buses have appeared in the mourning site in front of the Hana Music Information Center with a large picture of Kim Jong Il with a broad smile on his face hung in its facade. 
					
					 The center was the last stop of the field guidance tour made by the leader. 
					
					On the buses some mourners warm themselves, taking hot drink or medical service. 
					
					 Medical workers choose patients among those standing guards of honor beside the picture and invite them to the buses.
					
					 Pak Il Nam, a deputy section chief of the Ministry of Land and Marine Transport, told KCNA:
					
					  "Respected Comrade Kim Jong Un took special measures for the health of people standing guards of honor in cold days. Yesterday he even sent thousands of waistbands to mourning sites. 
					
					 We decided to park brand-new large buses around here, leaving their engines running all day long to ensure temperature as high as 25 degrees centigrade inside the buses. Officials stay here to solve any problems."
					
					 Pak Yong Ryol, a 63-year-old woman who had the honor to have a picture taken with President Kim Il Sung, said:
					
					 "I am so grateful to respected Comrade Kim Jong Un for his deep loving care. He is, in deed, identical to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il. Thank you very much, Comrade Kim Jong Un."

articles.title: Korean Children Miss Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Korean Children Miss Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Looking at children of Chungsong Kindergarten No. 1 in Rangnang District, Pyongyang booming out the words of a song with their eyes full of tears, people were deeply touched by the song. 
					
					 The song "I Miss Father" is about a child seeing leader Kim Jong Il in dream.
					
					 Nam Un Sil, a kindergarten teacher who participated in more than 10 performances given in honor of leader Kim Jong Il, told KCNA:
					
					  "The children had practiced this song so hard for next year's national art performance of kindergarten children. They wanted to sing the song for leader Kim Jong Il in the performance. But he passed away suddenly. They have asked me every day where he is and what they should do now.
					
					 I have said they should sing the song before respected Comrade Kim Jong Un. Though leader Kim Jong Il passed away, he will be with our children as their eternal sun."

articles.title: Let's Become Eternal Comrades of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Let's Become Eternal Comrades of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The Korean people are called upon by a political essay of Rodong Sinmun Sunday to become eternal revolutionary comrades of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The essay says:
					
					The Koreans came to know about the world of comradeship looking up to the image of Kim Jong Il after the untimely loss of President Kim Il Sung. The world of comradeship has been brought home to them again at this time of mourning over the sudden loss of Kim Jong Il thanks to the image of Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il loved and valued the call of comrade all his life and he breathed his last as ardent as the call.
					
					 He showed what a comrade means by living his life as comrade of Kim Il Sung and the people. He formulated the new concept of comrade throughout his great life.
					
					 What was it that he truly wished?
					
					 Whether people truly like or not is a standard of the revolution set by him and it is his last instruction and the revolutionary task facing us.
					
					 Revolutionary comrades of Kim Jong Il,
					
					 Let us think whether it would help advance the country and improve people's livelihood when we do ideological and economic work and cultural construction or when we make a product or modernize a factory.
					
					 Korea would lead the world!
					
					 This was what was intended and hoped for by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Our life goal is remaining truly faithful to him.
					
					 Kim Jong Il put forward the respected young Kim Jong Un, son of Mt. Paektu, at the van of the ranks. It was aimed to accomplish the sacred revolutionary cause reflected in of Patriotic Song.
					
					 Let us become eternal comrades of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Let us become eternal revolutionary comrades of Kim Jong Un, sun of the 21st century who rose up with all of the people in his fold true to the undying behests of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Slams for Blocking Condolatory Visits to North
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Slams for Blocking Condolatory Visits to North

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a condolence message from Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad Saturday.
					
					 The president in his message said he could not repress grief at the news that HE Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the DPRK, passed away.
					
					 Expressing condolences to Kim Jong Un and to the governmen Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on Dec. 23 editorially lashed out at the south Korean authorities for blocking condolatory visits to the north.
					
					 The editorial referred to the fact that an opposition party proposed on Dec. 22 to form a mourners' group consisting of mainly members of the People's Council for National Reconciliation and Cooperation to be sent to the north.
					
					 It said that the council is an organization having competency enough to convey the south side's intention of sharing sorrow with the north as it is made up of ruling and opposition parties, religious circles and civic and social organizations.
					
					 The present chief executive of south Korea, however, opposed this proposal, the editorial noted, and continued:
					
					 The "government" claimed that only in case the north sends a mourners' group to the south, it allows a condolatory visit in return for the visit. The action taken to block the condolatory visit by the Roh Moo Hyun Foundation was too narrow-minded behavior quite contrary to reason. 
					
					 It urged the "government" not to block condolatory visits to the north, whether they are "government"-level or non-governmental level and whether they are visits by politicians or by media persons.

articles.title: S. Korean Internet Reports Worldwide Condolences over
articles.content:
S. Korean Internet Reports Worldwide Condolences over

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The world is expressing condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il in great grief, the south Korean Internet paper Jaju Minbo reported on Dec. 23.
					
					 Super senior leaders of China mourned the demise of Chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK Kim Jong Il with the greatest courtesy, the paper said.
					
					 The wind of mourning is getting hotter among the Chinese people day by day in particular, it noted. Posted on Internet of China were hundreds of articles and poems mourning Kim Jong Il.
					
					 This is because they were captivated by his politics and charisma, it said.
					
					 The United Nations officially declared mourning time and observed it, the paper said, adding that the residents in the north must be mourning his demise in bitterer grief.
					
					 It hoped that the "government" and people of south Korea would share the pain with the compatriots in the north with sincerity as fellow countrymen.

articles.title: Venezuelan Party Arranges Mourning Station
articles.content:
Venezuelan Party Arranges Mourning Station

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Communist Party of Venezuela arranged a mourning station at its building to mourn for the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 General Secretary Oscar Figuera, together with members of the Leadership of the Party, visited the mourning site on Dec. 21 to express deep condolences in humble reverence on the demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Brazilian Political Parties Proclaim Mourning Period
articles.content:
Brazilian Political Parties Proclaim Mourning Period

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Communist Party and the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil on Dec. 20 proclaimed the mourning period on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The leaderships of the two parties set the days from Dec. 19 when an important report on his demise was announced to Dec. 29 as the mourning period and decided that the leaderships and other party members would pay condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy in Brasilia during the period.
					
					 They also decided to give wide publicity to the greatness of Kim Jong Il through party organs and Internet homepages and organize mourning events with sincerity.

articles.title: Indonesian Committee for Mourning Demise Formed
articles.content:
Indonesian Committee for Mourning Demise Formed

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- A committee for mourning the demise of leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Indonesia on Friday.
					
					 Eko Suryo Santjojo, general chairman of the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia, was elected chairman of the mourning committee.
					
					 The committee declared that it would hold mourning events in the period from Dec. 23 to 29 and the party members would pay a silent tribute to the memory of Kim Jong Il before any party meeting.

articles.title: Nigerian Committee for Mourning Demise Formed
articles.content:
Nigerian Committee for Mourning Demise Formed

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- An inaugural meeting for the Nigerian National Committee for Mourning the Demise of HE Kim Jong Il was held in Abuja on December 22.
					
					 The meeting elected Ibrahim Mantu, former deputy president of Senate of Nigeria and co-chairman of the International Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung and chairman of the Nigerian Preparatory Committee, as its chairman. 
					
					 The Mourning Committee decided to organize various events to mourn the demise of Kim Jong Il, great master of world politics and benevolent teacher of the Korean people and progressive humankind.
					
					 Meanwhile, a memorial service was held in Abuja on the same day.

articles.title: Thai Organization Mourns Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Thai Organization Mourns Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand on Dec. 22 issued a statement on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The statement noted that the demise of Kim Jong Il, an illustrious commander born of Heaven who remained unfazed even in face of an attack of any formidable enemy, is an irrevocable loss to the Korean and world revolutions.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il led the DPRK along the road of Juche and conducted energetic activities for national reunification and global independence.
					
					 The DPRK is shedding its brilliant rays all over the world thanks to the undying feats performed by him.
					
					 Though he passed away, the Korean people are sure to win as they have the Juche-oriented party, the matchless army and the socialist system whereby the people are single-mindedly united, his achievements.
					
					 The Organization expressed firm belief that the Korean people will overcome the present sorrow and build a thriving socialist nation and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche without fail under leadership of Kim Jong Un, the great successor to the revolutionary cause of Juche.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Organizations Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Organizations Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Bangladeshi organizations issued statements on Dec. 21 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea in its statement expressed profound condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il, noting that his demise is a great loss to the Korean people as they lost their outstanding leader.
					
					 The statement stressed that his immortal revolutionary exploits would be remembered not only by the Korean people but by progressive humankind.
					
					 The Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy in its statement noted that Kim Jong Il worked miracles and achieved victories despite the worst adversity as he was possessed of extraordinary political caliber.
					
					 The Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee in its statement said Kim Jong Il was the great leader of the Korean people and a close friend of the Bangladeshi people.
					
					 The statement expressed belief that the Korean people would certainly win victory in the just struggle to defend socialism and achieve the independent reunification of the country under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Indonesian Party Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Indonesian Party Mourn Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The Pioneer Party of Indonesia issued a statement on Dec. 22 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The statement said:
					
					 The demise of HE Kim Jong Il who was source of strength and destiny of the Korean nation is the greatest loss to the Workers' Party, the government and the people of Korea.
					
					 He dedicated all his life only to the prosperity of the country and the happiness and well-being of its people, regarding the people as his teacher. Not only the Korean people but also the world progressive people deeply grieve over his demise.
					
					 We all members of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia express profound condolences over his demise.
					
					 We hope that the bereaved families and the Korean people will weather the present difficulties and display strength and courage and carry forward the noble cause of HE Kim Jong Il and carve out a rosy future under the leadership of Comrade Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The great leader HE Kim Jong Il will always live in the hearts of the Korean people and the world progressive people.

articles.title: Political Party of Nepal Calls for Events Mourning
articles.content:
Political Party of Nepal Calls for Events Mourning

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Nepal Worker-Peasant Party instructed the party organizations at all levels and all party members to hold events mourning the demise of leader Kim Jong Il and express profound condolences to the Korean people.
					
					 Its Central Committee issued a statement in this regard on Monday.
					
					 The members of the leadership of the C.C., the Nepal Worker-Peasant Party, and all the party members express profound condolences over his demise, the statement said, adding though he passed away, the exploits performed by him in the struggle against the U.S. imperialists and for socialist construction would last forever.
					
					 It expressed belief that the Workers' Party of Korea under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, will carry forward to the last the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by President Kim Il Sung and advanced by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Foreign Media Reports Mourning Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Media Reports Mourning Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Media of different countries continue giving wide publicity to events held in the DPRK to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il in humblest reverence.
					
					 The Xinhua News Agency of China said on Wednesday that though snow fell in Pyongyang the Korean people expressed condolences over the demise of supreme leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The mourning place at Kim Il Sung Square where major events would take place is crowded with an endless stream of Pyongyangites visiting it to express condolences.
					
					 Some mourners were calmly weeping when they were paying silent tribute after laying flowers and some others were reluctant to leave there even after observing silence, their backs bent and chocked with tears. 
					
					 People's Website, an Internet homepage of China, posted an article, saying that snow began to fall in Pyongyang at dawn on Wednesday but this could not prevent Pyongyangites from their mourning the demise of supreme leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Voice of Russia aired a program on the same day under the title "Total of more than five million citizens mourn the leader's demise in the capital city of the DPRK." 
					
					 It said: An endless stream of people is climbing Mansu Hill where the statue of President Kim Il Sung stands.
					
					Their number reached 450,000 at dawn of Tuesday and it went beyond 800,000 at noon.
